author: Special Correspondent
text:
TIRUCHI: Officers of the Customs Preventive Unit of Tiruchi and Salem seized 2.326 kg of heroin from the house of a Nigerian national at Tiruchengode in Namakkal district on Monday.

The Nigerian national, Henry Chuma Offor, was arrested at Kochi on February 9 when he was about to send abroad four kg of heroin and methamphetamine valued at Rs. 7 crore. A release from the Customs Commissioner, Tiruchi K.C. Johny said following the arrest of the Nigerian national, the officers of Customs Preventive Unit Tiruchi and Salem Customs Preventive Unit searched the residence of the Henry Chuma on Wednesday and seized 2.326 kg of heroin worth Rs. 4.652 crore in international market. He was remanded in judicial custody at Cochin. The Nigerian national was living in a rented house under the guise of studying in a nearby college. The Customs officers also seized US dollars and Nigerian currencies equivalent to Rs. 1.09 lakh. The seized goods were produced before the NDPS Court, Salem and subsequently forwarded to Customs at Koch.
title: Heroin sized from Nigerian national’s house
